subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{liushu|ic}} - a group of pigs ([[豩]]) fleeing from a fire ([[火]]). The bronze script form has a hand with a stick ([[攴]]), indicating that the fire would have been started on purpose, in manner to get rid of the pigs. The large seal script form also has what looks like [[爾]] on the right side.

subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|兵燹|へいせん}} {{qualifier|rare}}: a [[fire]] caused by war; by extension, a [[battle]]

subSections.title: Etymology 1
Usage notes
subSections.text: Spelled using this kanji, {{lang|ja|燹}} excludes the "''controlled agricultural burn''" sense found found under the {{l|ja|野火}} spelling.

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ほそけ}}
Compound of {{compound|ja|sort=ほそけ|火|tr1=ho|t1=fire|退く|tr2=soku|t2=to push away, to make distant}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

The [[kun'yomi]] for {{m|ja|火}} is usually ''hi'', but it can appear as ''ho'' or ''fu'', particularly in older compounds.

The ''soku'' changes to ''soke'' due to [[conjugation]] of the verb. Grammatically, the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of ''soke'' indicates the transitive.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

Use of this kanji {{lang|ja|燹}} is rare, and is an example of [[熟字訓|jukujikun]]. The more common spelling is {{m|ja|火退}}.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|ほそけ}} {{lb|ja|rare|sort=ほそけ}}

# a [[backburn]]: a [[controlled]] fire deliberately set in the path of a [[wildfire]] to create a [[firebreak]] by removing [[combustible]] material

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: The more common word for this is {{m|ja|向火}}, {{ja-r|向かい火|むかいび}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>
